prompts: Please Select Type!
What did you do today?
Do you have any pets? If so, tell me about them. If not, would you like to have some?
What is you favorite type of weather for you day off?
What do you do to relax?
Tell me about some of your hobbies.
What is you second favorite color?
If you could take a vacation to anyplace in the world free of charge, where would you go?
What's your favorite breakfast food?
What’s the craziest thing a boss has ever asked you to do?
Are you reading any good books right now? I’d love some recommendations.
What’s a book you hated that everyone else loved, and vice versa?
If you could only eat one thing for the rest of your life, what would it be?
What’s the weirdest thing you’ve ever eaten?
What’s your go-to comfort food?
Do you prefer action-packed vacations or relaxing on the beach?
What was your favorite extracurricular in elementary school?
What’s the most unbelievable thing that’s ever happened to you?
What’s the strangest compliment you’ve ever gotten?
Have you ever thought of a cool invention or company, only to discover someone had already invented or started it?
What would be your ideal superpower?
If you could have any type of animal for a pet, what would it be?
What job would you be absolutely horrible at?
What movie has everyone else seen but you haven’t?
What is your dream job and what makes it so amazing?
Which historical figure wins the award for being most hardcore?
What commercial convinced you NOT to buy the product they are pushing?
What was the funniest way that you have been injured?
If your life was a movie, what songs would be on the soundtrack?
What scene from a TV show will you never forget?
What movie trope annoys you the most?
What terrible movie do you love?
What song do you have to sing along with when you hear it?
If someone painted a portrait of you, how would it look (clothes, background, pose, etc.) and what else would be in the painting with you?
What game are / were you really good at?
What reality TV show would you most like to see made?
What is the most unprofessional thing you’ve seen someone do?
What secret conspiracy would you like to start?
What’s the most ridiculous fact you know?
What is the funniest joke you know by heart?
In 40 years, what will people be nostalgic for?
What part of a kid’s movie completely scarred you?
What kind of secret society would you like to start?
If animals could talk, which would be the rudest?
What’s the best inside joke you’ve been a part of?
What is the most embarrassing thing you have ever worn?
What’s the most imaginative insult you can come up with?
What’s the weirdest thing a guest has done at your house?
What inanimate object do you wish you could eliminate from existence?
What is the weirdest thing you have seen in someone else’s home?
What movie would be greatly improved if it was made into a musical?
What sport would be the funniest to add a mandatory amount of alcohol to?
If you were arrested with no explanation, what would your friends and family assume you had done?
What is something that is really popular now, but in 5 years everyone will look back on and be embarrassed by?
What fictional character is amazing in their book / show / movie, but would be insufferable if you had to deal with them in mundane everyday situations?
If you were held at gun point and told that if you didn’t impress them with your dance moves you would be killed, what dance moves would you bust out?
What would be the hat to end all hats? What could you wear on your head that would make people stop what they are doing and stare in awe and amazement?
What are you completely over and done with?
What’s the most immature thing your parents do?
What is the most unusual fear you have?
What’s the most ridiculous argument you’ve had?
What do you wish people would stop asking you?
What pictures or paintings have had a big impact on you?
What movie or book character are you most similar to?
What part of your culture are you most and least proud of?
What’s the worst and best thing about being your gender?
What random stranger has had the biggest impact on your life?
What achievement are you proud of but most people would consider silly or weird?
What silly or funny thing makes you afraid or creeps you out?
What is the most important change that should be made to your country’s education system?
What is something you think you will regret in the future not starting now and what is something you already regret not starting sooner?
If you could put your brain in a robot and live indefinitely, would you?
If you could replace the handshake as a greeting, what interesting new greeting would you replace it with?
When does time pass fastest for you and when does it pass the slowest?
Are humans fundamentally different than animals? If so, what makes us different?
What fact are you really surprised that more people don’t know about?
What are you most passionate about and what do you wish you were more passionate about?
What’s the best comeback you’ve ever heard?
Who haven’t you seen or talked to in a long time and hope they are doing okay?
What’s something that you’ve never been able to do well?
What is the silliest reason someone you’ve known has completely lost it?
What is quite possibly the most annoying thing ever?
What’s the weirdest tradition your family has?
If you could choose anyone living or dead, who would you choose to lead our country?
Who was the most power mad person you’ve met?
What is something that you think people are only pretending to like or are deluding themselves into liking?
What are some of the telltale signs that your date is creepy?
What is your very first memory?
What’s the most embarrassing thing you’ve said or done around someone you had a crush on?
What doesn’t exist but you desperately want / need it?
What was the most disappointing ending to a great book / movie / game?
What was the most perfect ending to a great book / movie / game?
What would you do if someone left a duffle bag filled with $2,000,000 on your back porch?
If everything in your house had to be one color what color would you choose?
What question have you always wanted to ask, but were too afraid of looking stupid?
What would your warning label say if every person was required to have one?
If you went into a coma and woke up in the year 2120, what would be the first thing you would want to know?
What do you think about in the shower?
What’s the dumbest thing you’ve done in the last 24 hours?
What’s the best thing you’ve seen in the last 24 hours?
When were some occasions you did a double take?
What kind of old person would you like to become?
What’s the closest thing to magic that actually exists?
If you had to choose your spouse based on just one question, what question would you ask?
Tell me about a funny interaction you had with an animal.
Tell me about a time you got in trouble with your friends.
What is your favorite holiday and why?
What do you do with your free time?
Tell me about your favorite book.
Tell me about your favorite TV show.
Tell me about you favorite movie.
What's you favorite time of day?
Tell me a scary story?
Do you believe in ghosts?
What is your favorite childhood game?
Do you like video games?
Tell me about a weird dream you've had.
Tell me about the coolest dream you've ever had.
If you could have a friend dragon or unicorn, which would you prefer?
Would you rather have a pocket dragon or a fairy friend?
Are you a dog-person or a cat-person? Why?
How are you feeling today?
Tell me three things you like most about yourself
If you could do anything right now, what would it be?
If you could talk to someone right now and be completely open with them- inflicting no reprecussions- who would you speak to?
If your brain were a tangible, physical place, what would it be like?
What are the qualities needed for a good friendship?
Tell me about your proudest moment
What makes you happy in a relationship?
Who’s the most important role model or mentor you’ve had in your life?
Are People Defined By The Culture They Grew Up In?
Do You Think The Future Will Be Brighter Or Darker Than Today?
Will The Next Generation Be In A Better Or Worse Position Than Ours?
How Do Our Roles Define Us In Society?
Are Our Roles Defined For Us, Or Do We Define Them?
Are You Comfortable With The Role(S) You Play In Life?
What Does It Really Mean To Love Someone?
Are You Happy With Your Current Experience Of Life?, If not, what change would make you happy?
What Do You Do To Make Other People Happy?
Where Do You See Our Relationship At This Time Next Year?
What’s An Irrational Fear That You Have?
Do You Worry About Your Work?
What Do You Fear For In The Future?
How Do You Deal With Things That Scare You?
If You Could Instill One Piece Of Advice In A Newborn Baby’s Mind, What Advice Would You Give?
What Do You Do Over And Over Again That You Hate Doing?
What Do You Understand Today About Your Life That You Did Not Understand A Year Ago?
What Makes You Uncomfortable?
When You Look Into The Past, What Do You Miss The Most?
What’s The Best Part Of Being You?
What is holding you back from being the person you want to be?
If you had to sum up the whole human species in 3 words, what would those words be?
Is human nature constant or is it molded by culture? Can human nature be completely changed by culture or society?
How does tribalism and creating in groups and out groups (e.g. race, religion, sport team fans, people with a hobby, etc.) help and hurt society?
What is the most uplifting thing happening in the world right now? What is the most tragic thing?
Can people with vastly different cultural backgrounds live together peacefully? How?
What does honor mean to you? How important is it to you? Does your culture value honor? What exemplifies honor in your culture?
How important are morals in a healthy society? What are the most important morals for citizens to have?
In the distant past, a person’s life was very similar to their grandparents’ and grandchildren’s lives. How has the rapid pace of technological advancement changed society?
Do people have an obligation to help others or should people be responsible for helping themselves?
What are the most important factors in maintaining a well functioning society? What does it mean for a society to function well?
What does the ideal life look like?
What does it mean to die well?
Who do you know who is living life to the fullest?
If you died today, what regrets would you have about your life?
Is taking a life ever justified? If so, where is the line? When is a person’s life considered forfeit?
What are the pros and cons of colonizing other planets? How could this help or hurt the human race?
What is most likely to bring about the extinction of the human race? How can it be avoided?
What would be the best possible scenario for how the world will develop in the next 25 years? What do we need to do to get there?
Will humans as a species ever be able to work together as a whole to achieve a goal? What is holding humans back from working together on a global scale?
What do you think about the singularity? The idea that eventually artificial intelligence will advance to the point where computers are more intelligent than humans.
How are emotions useful for humans and the human race?
Are emotions necessary for human survival? Why or why not?
What is the strongest emotion? How about the most destructive?
Do people have a right to be happy or should they have to earn it?
Do animals experience emotions? If so, do they experience emotions in the same way humans do? If not, how do they experience the world and what dictates their behavior?
What single event has had the biggest impact on who you are?
Do you think the future will be better than the present? Why?
What’s the most crucial thing for a healthy relationship?
What lies do you most often tell yourself?
Do you think the present is better than 50 years ago? Why?
What keeps you up at night?
What do a lot of parents do that screws up their kid?
What is the most important thing a person can do to improve themselves?
Will humans spread out among the stars or just be a brief blip in Earth’s history?
Is there any way for governments to avoid power corrupting its politicians? If so, how? If not, what part of human nature makes corruption unavoidable?
Why are there so many people who are lonely? Why is it so hard for people to make real connections when almost everyone wants to make real connections?
What are the most common road blocks that stop people from achieving their dreams?
Why are people so bad at judging risks? For example: people are terrified of murders, terrorists, and flying but they are much more likely to die driving to the store.
What are some examples of outside behaviors that are symptoms of inner emotional scars?
Why does society place such a high value on beauty when it serves no functional purpose?
What is the most important object you own?
What job doesn’t exist but should?
What is the most impressive thing you know how to do?
What is something most people do easily but you find very difficult?
What is something that many people take seriously but shouldn’t?
What issue do most people think is black and white but you think there is a lot nuance to?
If you have children what career do you hope they peruse and what career would you never want them to get into?
Do you feel comfortable having kids in today’s world?
Would the world be better off without humans?
What do you think the most important thing in life is?
What human emotion is strongest?
What is worth fighting for?
Is there a way to dismantle a corrupt government and replace it?
What do you think is the most difficult aspect of life?
Can the realms of science and religion exist in harmony?
Why do you think people fear the differences in each other?
How strong is fear and what can stop it?
Some people say that the only thing stronger than fear is curiosity. What do you think?
Is fear seperate from love or apart of it?
Humans have incredibly complex social structures. What is one aspect of these social structures that you wish would change?
What is unconditional love?
Are there different kinds of love? If so, tell me what they are.
If someone you loved deeply commited an atrocious crime, would your love spur you to help them escape punishment or make them except atonement?
What does a life-well-spent look like to you?
What’s your most vivid memory from school?
What’s one thing you cherish about our family?
What’s one thing you’d like to accomplish in your life?
What’s one thing you could change about someone if you could?
What is your favorite memory with your sibling(s)?
What’s one thing you least value about our family?
What’s the hardest thing you had to do at work or school?
What type of parents do you have?
Who in this world is your example for a good relationship?
Who in this world is your example for a bad relationship?
What is one thing you would change about one of your relationships if you could?
When is it okay to lie, and when is it not?
A shoe falls out of the sky. Tell me why.
How does choosing whether to use a blue towel or a red towel to dry his hands that morning affect the rest of his day?
A man is stranded on a deserted island. The only other living creature on the island is an old, cranky goose with a broken wing.
Your character lives in a tower that goes infinitely up and infinitely down. What is his/her life like? Is this tower a prison, or is it wonderful?
You've been spirited into you favorite story, but as the villain. Do you follow the storyline or help the hero?
An expedition into the jungle has gone wrong.
Four women are stranded on a small, rocky island.
You are a celebrity cook who loves the good life. That’s why you owe the mafia money.
Prison break time is the best time of the year.
A popular comedian sits on a park bench. He is the type that shocks and amuses his audience with outrageous ideas. A bum sits down next to him.
You have been sleepwalking lately.
Imagine you are a dog. Now tell me about a day in your life from your perspective.
You find strange, muddy footprints leading up to your front door.
A stranger sits down next to you on a train and gets up, leaving a package behind.
Your parents tell you that they actually don’t know whose child you are.
You can solve murders simply by stepping foot at the crime scene. Problem is, no one believes you.
The morning after a blizzard you make your way outside and slowly start to realize everyone has disappeared
You are gifted with the strongest, most elusive sword in the kingdom, but if you use it you will never be able to speak again.
You come into possession of a ring that can change the weather to whatever you decide.
Satan puts you in charge of Hell.
You’re an immortal who lives at a beach resort.
You and your ghost best friend are an infamous crime-solving team.
You start realizing that at least one aspect of every dream you have comes true the next day.
You find a polaroid camera that seems to predict the future: its pictures show what will happen exactly 5 minutes from the moment you take them.
As a joke, you put on a tinfoil hat. Suddenly your mind goes completely silent.
Silence is now literally golden. For every day of total silence a person completes, they receive a piece of gold.
You wake up 10 years younger. What do you do?
A group of scientists on a submarine are alarmed when they spot what looks like a functioning lighthouse at the bottom of the ocean.
Coffee is illegal and you have to single handedly smuggle it into the country.
Death has been flirting with you for a long time, but they’ve become a bit annoying.
If life were a video game, what would some of the cheat codes be?
You’re a mad scientist, what scientific experiment would you run if money and ethics weren’t an issue?
If your five-year-old self suddenly found themselves inhabiting your current body, what would your five-year-old self do first?
You're on holiday in a new city and you were walking along talking to a friend, when you suddenly realise they're no longer with you.
You have invented a time machine and set off to the time you would most love to visit.
You are a security guard at a villain's secret lair.
You get a newspaper delivered to your door every morning, then one day it's tomorrow's paper, telling you what will happen today.
Everyone has a superpower based on the topography of where they were born (i.e. mountains, deserts, etc.). You are the first person to be born in space.
You turn up for a job interview, but instead of being offered a job, you are invited to join an illegal activist group who are fighting to right the wrongs in the government.
A wizard stopped villains by wiping their memory and the memory of everyone who knew them. You just found one of your old diaries and discovered that you were once one of these villains.
You've gained the ability to change your age for a couple hours. What do you do first with this ability?
You woke up this morning as your 5 year old self! You mind is the same, but you're body is that of a child's once again.
Your pet has suddenly started talking, and you are not so sure its a good thing...
When taking out the trash, you see that someone has thrown away a treasure chest of gold and dubloons.
The world has flooded and people have split into two factions, marines and pirates. What side are you on?
You wake up in Wonderland, and with every hour you spend there you forget more and more about who you are.
You wake up in a castle and everyone present recognizes you as their current monarch.
You've been kidnapped by a witch.
Your friend invites you to a party, but when you arrive all the party-goers are reanimated skeletons. You are the only person in attendance who seems to notice.
You've gained the ability to leave your body and travel as a spirit. Where do you go?
You've gained the ability to leave your body and travel as a spirit. You meet the person who has been haunting you.
After finding a mysertious stone in your relative's possessions, you are suddenly able to see spectors who offer you a VIP membership in an ancient club.
You find an old pocketknife that can cut through anything like butter.
You gain the ability to teleport, but you have no control over when it happens or where you end up.
You've fallen into your favorite childhood cartoon. The main character tries to help you get back out.
You have gained the ability to see music. One day a representative of your favorite musical artist approaches you with a strange offer.
You decide to go on a trip.
You enter a cafe that offers you a 10 minute meeting with someone you lost with every purchase of a large coffee
You are the only person on Earth with a certain skill. That skill becomes the most sought after overnight.
You've gained the ability to remove people's senses temporarily.
Your friend mistakenly sets you up on a blind date with someone in the mafia.
You are offered a job stealing back a country's stolen artifacts.
You've become a flower.
You've become a fish.
You've acquired the ability to fly.
You can jump into people's phones. When inside, the phone takes an appearance a house according to the owner's content.
You become indestructable for a day.
You're pet cat mysteriously gains the ability to say one word.
You see the same dark clad man in your dreams every night.
You have a pet parrot who starts to repeat more and more concerning things that he hears in the middle of the night.
After moving into a new neightborhood recenctly, you begin to notice that the same exact people walk by your house at the same exact times of day.
The pocket watch your late relative had given you has one very unique and ominous quality.
You hear a rumour that there is a serpentine monster asleep underneath the local lake.
You can recreate any dish you've eaten yourself.
You discover that your ancestors were royalty when you get a castle through inheirtance.
You discover a large manor you mysteriously inherited has a terrible secret.
You discover a large manor you mysteriously inherited has a curious secret.
You discover a large manor you mysteriously inherited is incredibly haunted.
You've started hearing singing in the woods at night.
You can replicate anything you touch.
Your imaginary friend from childhood is back. And they need your help.
You find an old witch hat that whispers secrets.
Trees talk to each and you began to hear them.
After saving a cat from getting hit by a car, you receive a letter in the mail stating you will soon receive your gratitude gift.
You find a pair of glasses that, when you look through them, the world looks very different.
You start having dreams about a missing person, who tells you that need help.
You find a mask that grants you a superpower.
One day, your emotions began to change the weather.
Your drawings can temporarily come to life.
You discover a shocking secret after playing your deceased father's favorite record backwards.

One day, you develope a disease that slowly begans to turn your body to porcelain. You discover this disease was genetic and of you family members the one person who ever beat the illness was your estranged aunt.
You become the master of silence. You can silence anything.
You can breathe underwater. You find a strange structure in the ocean on one of your 'walks'.
An ancient spirit moves in next door. They want to learn in the modern age, and they want you to help them.
You are visted by aliens one night. They would like you to explain humanity to them as simply as you can.
A space alien crash lands in your yard one night. They need your help to get to the space embassy, located on the other side of the country.
You wake up as a knight in a medieval era. You are tasked with tracking down a demon.
You wake up in medieval times in nothing but your pajamas, but you have your smartphone, and somehow it doesn't seem to be losing its charge.
You are chosen for an intergalatic peace experiment. You must live one Earth month amongst other sentient species from around the universe on an isolated space station. What are your days like?
You can the ability to freeze time for everything except yourself. One day you are walking around a frozen world and notice movement not caused by you.
You've stumbled across evidence of ancient dragons in an old cavern near your home, and you learn they may not be completely extinct.
Your lover goes missing one day leaving only a cryptic note behind.
You're starting to suspect your lover may be involved in the mafia.
You're starting to suspect that your lover may have unusual abilities.
Recently, you have been re-living days. You wake up and live yesterday a second time.
In the woods you find an old kettle that seems to replicate whatever is put inside it.
That snide-talking cat that usually harasses you every morning has gone missing.
Lately, you've been hearing a voice in your head speaking a strange language. Just as you think you can no longer stand it, there is a knock at your door- and the voice goes silent.
Ever since you were a kid you would have dreams that you were other people. The person you dreamed of last night just appeared on the morning news.
Talk about a time when you had to work closely with someone whose personality was very different from yours.
Give me an example of a time you faced a conflict while working on a team. How did you handle that?
Describe a time when you struggled to build a relationship with someone important. How did you eventually overcome that?
We all make mistakes we wish we could take back. Tell me about a time you wish you’d handled a situation differently with a colleague.
Tell me about a time you needed to get information from someone who wasn’t very responsive. What did you do?
Describe a time when it was especially important to make a good impression on a client. How did you go about doing so?
Give me an example of a time when you did not meet a client’s expectation. What happened, and how did you attempt to rectify the situation?
Tell me about a time when you made sure a customer was pleased with your service.
Describe a time when you had to interact with a difficult client. What was the situation, and how did you handle it?
When you’re working with a large number of customers, it’s tricky to deliver excellent service to them all. How do you go about prioritizing your customers’ needs?
Tell me about a time you were under a lot of pressure. What was going on, and how did you get through it?
Describe a time when your team or company was undergoing some change. How did that impact you, and how did you adapt?
Tell me about the first job you’ve ever had. What did you do to learn the ropes?
Give me an example of a time when you had to think on your feet in order to delicately extricate yourself from a difficult or awkward situation.
Tell me about a time you failed. How did you deal with the situation
Tell me about a time you had to be very strategic in order to meet all your top priorities.
Describe a long-term project that you managed. How did you keep everything moving along in a timely manner?
Sometimes it’s just not possible to get everything on your to-do list done. Tell me about a time your responsibilities got a little overwhelming. What did you do?
Tell me about a time you set a goal for yourself. How did you go about ensuring that you would meet your objective?
Give me an example of a time you managed numerous responsibilities. How did you handle that?
Give me an example of a time when you were able to successfully persuade someone to see things your way at work.
Describe a time when you were the resident technical expert. What did you do to make sure everyone was able to understand you?
Tell me about a time when you had to rely on written communication to get your ideas across to your team.
Give me an example of a time when you had to explain something fairly complex to a frustrated client. How did you handle this delicate situation?
Tell me about a successful presentation you gave and why you think it was a hit.
Tell me about your proudest professional accomplishment.
Describe a time when you saw some problem and took the initiative to correct it rather than waiting for someone else to do it.
Tell me about a time when you worked under close supervision or extremely loose supervision. How did you handle that?
Give me an example of a time you were able to be creative with your work. What was exciting or difficult about it?
Tell me about a time you were dissatisfied in your work. What could have been done to make it better?
Tell me about yourself
Why are you interested in this role?
Tell me about a time when you failed to meet a deadline. What did you fail to do? What did you learn?
Describe two specific goals you set for yourself and how you were successful in meeting those goals. What factors led to your success?
Tell me about a time you had to work as a part of a team. What goal were you all working toward? How did your role on that team contribute to the attainment of the team’s goal?
Imagine you are in charge of a major project for a new client our firm just secured. How would you go about ensuring the end result is in line with the needs of the client?
Tell me about a time when you had to work closely with someone whose personality was very different from yours.
We all make mistakes we wish we could take back. Tell me about a time you wish you’d handled a situation differently with a colleague or friend.
Tell me about a time you were under a lot of pressure. What was going on, and how did you get through it?
Tell me about a time you failed. How did you deal with the situation?
Sometimes it’s just not possible to get everything on your to-do list done. Tell me about a time your responsibilities got a little overwhelming. What did you do?
Tell me about a time you were able to successfully persuade someone to see things your way.
Tell me about your proudest accomplishment.
Tell me about a time you were able to be creative with your work. What was exciting or difficult about it?
Tell me about your proudest accomplishment.
Can you tell me about the last time you had to act and there was no formal procedure on how to do so?
Can you tell me about a time when you had to deal with a customer that made unreasonable or stretched demands and how you created a win-win situation?
Can you tell us about a time you took initiative on a project?
Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond the call of duty.
Give me an example of a situation in which you positively influenced the actions of others.
Give an example of a goal you reached, and tell me how you achieved it.
Have you ever unintentionally offended or upset somebody? Can you describe the details? How did you fix the situation?
Give an example of an unpopular decision you’ve made, what the result was, and how you managed it.
What was your relationship with the best boss you ever had?
What qualities does a great boss have?
What qualities does a great subordinate have?
What qualities does a great team have?
Can you tell me about a time that you let someone down? How did you handle it?
When scheduling your time, what method do you use to decide which items are priorities?
Describe how you’ve handled a sudden interruption to your schedule.
What’s been the toughest criticism you received so far in your career? What did you do with it?
Can you describe the details of a time you were unfairly criticized?
When was the last time you got constructive feedback? What was it? What did you do with it?
Describe a time when you disagreed with your supervisor on how to accomplish something.
Have you ever had to convince your team to do a job they were reluctant to do?
Have you ever had a deadline you were not able to meet? What happened? What did you do?
Tell me about a time your co-workers had a conflict. How did you handle it?
How have you prioritized being assigned multiple projects?
Tell me about a difficult work challenge you’ve had.
Talk about a time when you had to adapt to big changes at work.
How have you dealt with an angry or upset customer?
Have you ever gone above and beyond to help a customer? What did you do?
Have you ever been in a business situation that was ethically questionable? What did you do?
Have you ever had a project that had to change drastically while it was in progress? Why? How did you do it?
Talk about a time when a co-worker was not doing their share on a project. How did you handle it?
Tell me about a major setback you’ve had. How did you deal with it?
What have you done when colleagues have been stressed out by a project?
Talk about a difficult problem you’ve had to solve. How did you solve it?
Have you ever had to defend a customer’s point of view? What did you do? Why?
Talk about a time when you’ve had to sell an idea to your colleagues.
What makes you a strong candidate for this position? What will you contribute to the team?
Do you have any teaching/tutoring or coaching/mentoring experience? If so, what kind?
What are your growth areas? How do you work to strengthen these areas?
Tell me about a time when you had to navigate an unexpected change.
Why are you applying for this position?
Give an example of an occasion when you used logic to solve a problem.
Did you ever make a risky decision? Why? How did you handle it?
Given an example of a goal you didn’t meet and how you handled it.
Have you ever dealt with company policy you weren’t in agreement with? How?
Share an example of how you were able to motivate employees or co-workers.
What do you do if you disagree with your boss?
Have you handled a difficult situation with a supervisor? How?
Have you been in a situation where you didn’t have enough work to do?
Describe a time when your team or company was undergoing some change. How did that impact you, and how did you adapt?
Tell me about the first job you’ve ever had. What did you do to learn the ropes?
Give me an example of a time when you had to think on your feet in order to delicately extricate yourself from a difficult or awkward situation.
Tell me about a time you failed. How did you deal with the situation?
Describe a time when it was especially important to make a good impression on a client. How did you go about doing so?
Give me an example of a time when you did not meet a client’s expectation. What happened, and how did you attempt to rectify the situation?
Describe a time when you had to interact with a difficult client. What was the situation, and how did you handle it?
When you’re working with a large number of customers, it’s tricky to deliver excellent service to them all. How do you go about prioritizing your customers’ needs?
Tell me about a time you had to be very strategic in order to meet all your top priorities.
Describe a long-term project that you managed. How did you keep everything moving along in a timely manner?
Sometimes it’s just not possible to get everything on your to-do list done. Tell me about a time your responsibilities got a little overwhelming. What did you do?
Tell me about a time you set a goal for yourself. How did you go about ensuring that you would meet your objective?
Give me an example of a time you managed numerous responsibilities. How did you handle that?
Give me an example of a time when you were able to successfully persuade someone to see things your way at work.
Describe a time when you were the resident technical expert. What did you do to make sure everyone was able to understand you?
Tell me about a time when you had to rely on written communication to get your ideas across to your team.
Give me an example of a time when you had to explain something fairly complex to a frustrated client. How did you handle this delicate situation?
Describe a time when you saw some problem and took the initiative to correct it rather than waiting for someone else to do it.
Tell me about a time when you worked under close supervision or extremely loose supervision. How did you handle that?
Give me an example of a time you were able to be creative with your work. What was exciting or difficult about it?
Tell me about a time you were dissatisfied in your work. What could have been done to make it better?
Give me an example of a time you faced a conflict while working on a team. How did you handle that?
Describe a time when you struggled to build a relationship with someone important. How did you eventually overcome that?
We all make mistakes we wish we could take back. Tell me about a time you wish you’d handled a situation differently with a colleague.
Tell me about a major setback you’ve had. How did you deal with it?
Tell me about a time you needed to get information from someone who wasn’t very responsive. What did you do?
